name: Hotel Felix

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been to Chicago several times now, and have generally been happy with the hotels I've stayed at. This time, I was torn between staying at the Hard Rock again or booking the Hotel Felix. The offer of free Wifi and a relatively inexpensive King size bed was irresistible. Unfortunately, we got neither. We booked through Hotels.com. As usual, when booking through an internet discount site, I felt like we were given one of the worst rooms in the hotel. Our room was directly across from the elevator. Let me mention a few of the positives about the hotel. The rooms are generally quiet (more on the exception to this later) and as mentioned by several other reviewers - impeccably clean. They offer nice H2O bath products, but are very stingy with them. We stayed four nights and were only given one bar of soap for the stay. Although we always tip our cleaning person, it wasn't enough to get her to leave us shampoo each day. The hotel is conveniently located near many great restaurants. For breakfast we loved Tempo Cafe and Original Pancake house. The doormen were friendly and helpful. Front desk staff not so friendly. We booked a king sized bed, and the person who checked us in ensured that we were getting one, but it was in fact queen-sized. (Maybe he thought we wouldn't notice in the small room). The bed was comfortable. The air quality in the room seemed to be better than in most hotels. Strangely, the room had an ice bucket, but no drinking glasses. Also, there was no coffee maker. One night people in the room next to us came in drunk at 4 am. The woman was sobbing and the man was shouting profanities. I find it hard to believe that their behaviour in the lobby wouldn't have caused some concern with the hotel staff, because they were fighting when they got off the elevator. It would have been nice if someone had intervened before the couple woke up everyone on my floor. We phoned the front desk, and they came up quickly and asked the people to be quiet. The noise continued a bit longer afterward. The hotel did not seem to have any security, and it appeared that people could come and go pretty easily. This brings me to the wifi. If like me you like to stream video on the internet - DON'T stay here. The Hotel Felix has the worst internet service I've had the displeasure to use in a long time. You cannot even watch a video on YouTube. I would much rather PAY for reliable internet than use such an archaic free service.
reviews.title: Worst Wifi in Chicago (that's why it's free)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: i booked hotel felix on expedia at about $80/night. small room with a queen bed, no storage space. it fit my needs, but people seem to have had problems with two bed requests. the hotel is modern, and the beds were very comfortable. fit and finish were good. i was a little worried about the housekeeping service as i found a number of hairs on the supposedly clean bed. all in all, a fair stay, decent for the price. probably about a 5 or 6 block walk to the red line, not a lot of buses run in the area. if you can find a good rate, you can probably find a more central hotel.
reviews.title: small but comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room is so small that my knees and shoulder are bruised from walking into the bed and hitting the tv. I am an average sized woman so being big is not the reason. The queen bed takes up most of the room. It has a flat screen that sticks out 6". My shoulder kept hitting the wall and my knee would hit the bed as the walkway was only 2 feet 3" wide. The 6" that the Tv stuck out made the walkway around 18". On the side of the bed near the window there was a very small area of 4 feet to put your bag. There were two pull out drawers under the bed to store clothing. This room is smaller than the rooms I have rented in Europe. The maid brought fresh towels each day but she did not vacuum or wash the floors. We asked for extra blankets for our child so she could sleep on the floor but they did not bring them. We actually asked for the blankets to be in the room prior to our arrival and again when we arrived. We didn't feel very welcomed as no one ever said hello or greeted us.
reviews.title: Not a 4 star and service is bad

reviews.text: The prior contributor spoke volumes of this hotel. Dubious reservations practices, bait-and-switch mentality when booking through Priceline. You can get all the phone confirmations you want prior to your arrival. But the staff knows it's when you GET there that counts. And that's when they hit you up with non-availability of requested room types, tiny "Priceline" rooms that seem fit for a cruise ship, not a newly renovated hotel, and, oops, surcharges for two beds. GOTCHA!
reviews.title: Where COOL turns into COLD
Horrible service
reviews.text: The only plus which the prior contributor missed were the fit and finish of the rooms. They are of very high quality, curtains shut to create a dark and peaceful (albeit tiny) environment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a long week-end, and unfortunately I was sick. I was grateful to be staying in a nice hotel with a very comfortable bed and soft sheets. I loved the decor of the lobby and the room but it was rather cramped space. The location was good within walking distance to many restaurants and pubs and a whole foods grocery down the street. I didn't like that in order to get a cup of coffee in the morning you had to actually go into the nice restaurant. I need the cup of coffee to get ready in the a.m. I don't want to have to dress and be presentable just to get my jaffa. We also ordered room service one day which was good. The hotel staff didn't seem very approachable either. For the right price, I would stay here again, but would look for other options first. Loved the decor though!
reviews.title: Beautiful Finish Out, Great Location but Small as a Dorm Room

reviews.text: We arrived and Benjamin met us out front. He was great and the rest of our stay was great. Benjamin greeted us as we got out of the car and took control of the rest of our check in - he took care of our car, our luggage, walked us to the front desk, and made sure we knew he wanted to help with any issues. The next morning, Benjamin wasn't on duty, but his replacement was just as helpful and competent.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Great Room, Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the room, it was comfortable and clean. The bed was the most comfortable of any hotel we have stayed in. The free high speed worked fine. The location is not on Michigan Ave, but the 6 block walk was quick, and many amenities are even closer. Best of all, the scale in the nicely equipped fitness center weighed us 5 pounds lighter.
reviews.title: Low expectations----Surprisingly, we enjoyed our stay!

reviews.text: At the last minute (1 day notice)we booked a 4 star hotel on Priceline. This was our first time trying Priceline. When we were told our hotel was The Felix, we were very upset----not at the hotel, but at the location. We almost didn't go and were ready to lose the money.
reviews.title: Small but comfortable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, Sat. night in Chicago won out. What a surprise we had. Yes, the location is 5-6 blocks from where we would like to be. Yes, it is an old building and doesn't look like a 4 star hotel. We were ready to hate everything.
reviews.title: The Truth About Hotel Felix Chicago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for a weekend with my wife after a week long business trip (where I was at another hotel downtown). Overall, I've stayed in about 10 different downtown Chicago hotels over the past 5 or 10 years, so I'm using other stays as comparison in this market.
reviews.title: Clean hotel, super super small rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can say without hesistation - these were the smallest rooms of any of the hotels I've stayed in Chicago. It's described in previous reviews - but a run of the house room here is 1 queen bed, drawers underneath the bed, a couple of feet on each side of the bed and flat screen mounted the wall (a tiny desk and nightstand round out the furniture in the room). The closest doesn't have doors and can't fit a suit case. I've seen rooms in NYC bigger than these! Strangely enough, the bathroom was actually pretty spacious compared to the room itself.
reviews.title: Would Absolutely Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the positive side - room was super clean, bed was comfortable, no complaints about service (bad or good), everything went smooth. It's an easy walk from here anywhere downtown. If you just need a place to sleep and shower, this is perfect. if you want a room to spend more than a couple of waking hours in, this is a pretty clausterphobic.
reviews.title: Ridiculously small rooms

reviews.text: I know size usually isn't a criteria for star ratings, but I would think this should be rated a 3 star rather than 4 star if you start comparing this to places like the Fairmount, Westin, etc.
reviews.title: Excellent staff, Very comfortable rooms, WOULD RECOMMEND

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the room is on the small side.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used priceline to book and got a great rate in comparison to other river north hotels. Was a bit apprehensive about this hotel based on other reviews and comments about room size. It was on the smaller side but I've been in smaller and paid more! The room was clean the decor trendy and the bed was very comfortable. Each of the staff members we came in contact were helpful and friendly. The staff at the front entrance especially! We would definately return to the Hotel Felix.
reviews.title: Great location in River North

reviews.text: Nice little boutique hotel in a very good location for shopping, food and sight-seeing. The staff is friendly, especially the bellmen, and they do try to be helpful but there seems to be a lack of attention to detail. When a parcel arrived for us, there was no message from the front desk about its delivery. We had to ask before we received our parcel.
reviews.title: A wannabe but not quite there yet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are very comfortable but there are a number of touches missing in the room. There are no coffee/tea making facilities and no fridge either, so it is rather inconvenient if you want to have a drink without resorting to room service.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were also rather strange housekeeping practices that kept us intrigued but certainly not amused. The day after we arrived, housekeeping left a fresh set of toiletries in the bathroom, presumably to replace what we had already used on our first day there. However, we did not start on the new set of toiletries immediately as we hadn't finished the original lot. Inexplicably, on subsequent days, one item after another disappeared from the bathroom. First the second tube of shampoo was removed from our room and then a tube of shower gel. In their place, we were given tube after tube of hair conditioner which we did not need or use! This made us think that certain items were in short supply eg. the shampoo and others were in abundance, eg. the hair conditioner and the housekeeping staff had to keep juggling to make ends meet.
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay

reviews.text: Despite these drawbacks, it is still a rather nice hotel and I would hope that the management would give attention to the shortcomings mentioned above.
reviews.title: Better than I expected

description: 4-star boutique luxury hotel in hip River North district, steps to Mag Mile / Galleries / Clubs. Sophisticated Accommodations; Relaxed Rates.
